intro: Pimpinella khorasanica, commonly known as Persian cress, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Pimpinella khorasanica is also cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and fragrance.
